instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-3476: What is 820-3476? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.U7100: What is U7100? U7100 refers to the ISL6259 or ISL9239 charging IC on Macbooks from 2013 to the present.
definitions.ISL6259: What is ISL6259? This is a charging chip for Macbook motherboards from 2010 through 2015.
definitions.C7125: What is C7125? Capacitor between CHGR_BOOT and CHGR_PHASE important for bootstrapping creation of PPBUS_G3H on 2013-2015 macbook pros.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3476</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> stuck on 4V
threads.message: hello guys ,  have got an <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3476</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> that is stuck on 4v. I have replaced the ISL but still no difference , and I do not have a short to ground. please help

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3476</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> stuck on 4V
threads.message:
Do you get Magsafe amber light?
Check exact resistance between pins 17/18 and 27/28 of <CHIP>ISL6259</CHIP>.
Also post basic voltages for <CHIP>U7100</CHIP>; pins 1, 2, 3, 9, 12, 13, 14, 15, 19, 20, 27.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3476</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> stuck on 4V
threads.message:
thank you for your time
yes I get the light

resistance 27/28 =020.4
resistance 17/18 =003.6
pin 1=0.04
pin 2=20v
pin 3=4.8
pin 9=0.30
pin 12=3.4
pin 13=3.399
pin 14=3.399
pin 15=0.061
pin 19=5.4
pin 20=5.5
pin 27=19.83

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3476</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> stuck on 4V
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3476</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> stuck on 4V
threads.message: R/<CAPACITOR>C7125</CAPACITOR> look okay , and I get the same PPBUS value of 4.8V , I had also replaced <TRANSISTOR>Q7130</TRANSISTOR> but no changes

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3476</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> stuck on 4V
threads.message:
"R/<CAPACITOR>C7125</CAPACITOR> look okay"
Did you replace them?
Solders and traces OK?

Do you have 3V at pin 6?
Check/replace components from pins 5, 7, 8.
If still the same, change <CHIP>ISL6259</CHIP>.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3476</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> stuck on 4V
threads.message: I get 3V on pin 6 but 0V on 5,7 and 8

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3476</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> stuck on 4V
threads.message:
Pin 6 is OK then.
I didn't ask about voltage on pins 5, 7 & 8.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3476</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> stuck on 4V
threads.message: what do you wish me to do ?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3476</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> stuck on 4V
threads.message:
"Check/replace components from pins 5, 7, 8"

Did you replace <CAPACITOR>C7125</CAPACITOR>?
<RESISTOR>R7125</RESISTOR> is 0 ohm for sure?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3476</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> stuck on 4V
threads.message: you are a star. Thank you so much, I replaced components from pins 5, 7, 8 and there you have it , PPBUS in its full glory , thank you so much
